full_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, stir together 4 cups frozen hash browns, 1 can (10¾ oz) cream of chicken soup, ½ cup sour cream, and 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese until evenly combined.
3. Transfer mixture to a greased 9×13″ baking dish and smooth the top.
4. In a small bowl, combine 1 stick melted butter with 1½ cups crushed cornflakes; sprinkle evenly over casserole.
5. Bake 45 minutes until bubbly and golden on top. Let rest 5 minutes before serving.
summary: Mix hash browns, soup, sour cream, and cheese; top with buttery cornflake crumbs and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes until golden. Rest 5 minutes before serving.

full_instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil; cook 12 oz spaghetti until al dente, about 8 minutes, then drain, reserving ¼ cup pasta water.
2. In a skillet over medium heat, warm ¼ cup olive oil and add 4 cloves sliced garlic and ½ tsp red pepper flakes; sauté until garlic is light golden, about 1 minute.
3. Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet, tossing to coat; if dry, splash in reserved pasta water.
4. Season with salt to taste, stir in 2 Tbsp chopped parsley, and sprinkle with grated Parmesan before serving.
summary: Sauté garlic and chili in olive oil, then toss in drained spaghetti with a little pasta water. Finish with parsley and Parmesan for a simple, flavorful pasta dish.

full_instructions:
1. Heat 2 Tbsp oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high; season 1½ lbs chicken pieces with salt and pepper and brown in batches, about 4 minutes per side; remove and set aside.
2. Add 1 Tbsp oil, then sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 min; stir in 3 cloves minced garlic, 1 tsp grated ginger, and cook 1 min more.
3. Stir in 2 diced tomatoes, 1 chopped bell pepper, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp paprika, and return chicken to pot.
4. Pour in 3 cups chicken broth, bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 20 minutes until sauce thickens.
5. Stir in 1 cup frozen peas during last 5 minutes, adjust seasoning, and serve hot.
summary: Brown chicken, then sauté aromatics and spices; add tomatoes, peppers, and broth, simmer 20 minutes until thick. Stir in peas, adjust seasoning, and enjoy the hearty stew.

full_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C); grease and flour a 9×5″ loaf pan.
2. In a bowl, whisk 2 cups flour, 1 tsp baking powder, and ½ tsp salt.
3. In another bowl, cream ½ cup butter with 1 cup sugar until light, then beat in 2 eggs one at a time, followed by 1 tsp vanilla.
4. Alternate folding in the dry ingredients and ½ cup milk until just combined.
5. Pour half the batter into pan, sprinkle evenly with 2 Tbsp cinnamon-sugar, then top with remaining batter.
6. Bake 40 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean; cool before slicing.
summary: Combine dry mix and creamed butter-sugar, fold in eggs and milk, then layer batter with cinnamon-sugar swirl. Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.

full_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C); line a baking sheet with parchment.
2. Whisk 2 eggs with 1 Tbsp water in a shallow bowl.
3. In another bowl, mix 1 cup panko, ¼ cup grated Parmesan, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt to taste.
4. Dip 1 lb chicken strips in egg wash, then coat evenly in breadcrumb mixture.
5. Place on sheet, spray lightly with oil, and bake 20 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden and crispy.
summary: Coat chicken strips in egg and garlic-Parmesan panko, bake at 400°F for 20 minutes flipping once, until golden and crisp. Serve immediately.

full_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a bowl, combine ½ cup softened butter, 4 cloves minced garlic, and 2 Tbsp chopped parsley.
3. Slice a baguette lengthwise, spread garlic butter generously on cut sides.
4. Wrap in foil and bake 15 minutes, then unwrap and bake 5 minutes more until edges crisp.
5. Slice into pieces and serve warm.
summary: Spread garlic-parsley butter on baguette halves, wrap in foil, bake at 350°F for 15 minutes, then unwrap for 5 more until crisp. Serve warm.

full_instructions:
1. Melt 2 Tbsp butter in a pot over medium; sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 min of 3 cloves minced garlic until soft.
2. Add 2 cans (28 oz each) crushed tomatoes, 2 cups chicken or vegetable broth, 1 tsp sugar, and a handful of basil leaves; bring to a boil.
3. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes, then stir in ½ cup heavy cream and heat through.
4. Use an immersion blender to puree until smooth, season with salt and pepper, and serve hot garnished with basil.
summary: Sauté onion and garlic in butter, add tomatoes, broth, sugar & basil, simmer 15 minutes. Stir in cream, puree until smooth, season, and serve hot.

full_instructions:
1. Crack 6 eggs into a bowl with 2 Tbsp milk, salt, and pepper; whisk until just blended.
2. Heat 1 Tbsp butter in a nonstick skillet over low heat, swirl to coat.
3. Pour in egg mixture, let sit undisturbed 20 seconds, then gently stir with a spatula.
4. Continue cooking and folding for 2–3 minutes until soft curds form; remove from heat slightly underdone.
5. Transfer to a bowl, garnish with chives or cheese, and serve immediately.
summary: Whisk eggs with milk, season, and cook gently in butter over low heat, stirring to form soft curds. Remove just before set, garnish, and serve hot.

full_instructions:
1. Cook 8 oz fettuccine in salted water until al dente; reserve ¼ cup pasta water and drain.
2. In the same pot over low heat, melt 4 Tbsp butter with 2 cloves minced garlic for 1 minute.
3. Stir in 1 cup heavy cream and simmer 2 minutes until slightly thickened.
4. Remove from heat, add 1 cup grated Parmesan, stirring until melted and smooth; thin with reserved water as needed.
5. Toss pasta into sauce, season with salt & pepper, and serve garnished with parsley.
summary: Melt butter and garlic, add cream and simmer, then stir in Parmesan off heat to make sauce. Toss with pasta, thin if needed, season, and serve garnished.

full_instructions:
1. In a food processor, blend 2 cups fresh basil leaves, ⅓ cup pine nuts, 2 cloves garlic, and ½ cup Parmesan until finely chopped.
2. With machine running, slowly drizzle in ½ cup olive oil until smooth.
3. Season with salt & pepper to taste.
4. Toss 12 oz cooked pasta with pesto; add a splash of pasta water for creaminess.
5. Serve immediately, garnished with extra cheese and basil.
summary: Blend basil, nuts, garlic & cheese, drizzle in oil, and season. Toss with pasta and a splash of pasta water, garnish, and serve.

full_instructions:
1. Heat 2 Tbsp vegetable oil in a wok over high heat; add 1 tsp minced garlic and 1 tsp grated ginger, stir 30 seconds.
2. Add 4 cups mixed veggies (bell peppers, carrots, broccoli, snap peas); stir-fry 5 minutes until crisp-tender.
3. Whisk 2 Tbsp soy sauce, 1 Tbsp oyster sauce, and 1 tsp sesame oil; pour over veggies and cook 2 minutes more.
4. Remove from heat and serve immediately over steamed rice or noodles.
summary: Stir-fry garlic and ginger, add mixed vegetables and cook until crisp-tender. Pour in soy-oyster sauce mixture, cook 2 minutes, and serve over rice.

full_instructions:
1. In a trifle dish, layer 2 cups cubed pound cake, 2 cups mixed berries, and 1 cup whipped cream.
2. Repeat layers until dish is filled, ending with whipped cream.
3. Top with extra berries and chill at least 1 hour before serving.
4. Optionally drizzle with berry syrup or sprinkle with mint for garnish.
summary: Layer cake cubes, berries & whipped cream in a dish; repeat layers, top with berries, and chill for 1 hour before serving.
